value.title: Tesla raising price of ‘Full Self-Driving’ feature to $15,000 next month
value.excerpt: Elon Musk on Sunday announced the price of Tesla Inc.'s "Full Self-Driving" feature will rise by 25% next month, to from $12,000 to $15,000.

value.title: Britain sets out roadmap for self driving vehicle usage by 2025
value.excerpt: Britain said on Friday it wanted a widespread rollout of self-driving vehicles on roads by 2025, announcing plans for new laws and 100 million pounds ($119.09 million) of funding.

value.title: Experts warn no easy answer to how safe self-driving cars should be
value.excerpt: The Centre for Data Ethics and Innovation (CDEI) report warns that it might not be enough for self-driving cars to be safer than human drivers. It suggests the public may have much higher expectations of self-driving car safety.

value.title: Watch Out Tesla And Waymo! Lyft Debuts Self-Driving Vehicle In Las Vegas
value.excerpt: Ride-hailing service Lyft Inc. (NASDAQ: LYFT) has teamed up with Motional to bring self-driving taxis to cities around the nation, starting with Las Vegas.

value.title: Elon Musk drops details about Tesla's humanoid robot
value.excerpt: Tesla is set to unveil a new humanoid robot, called Optimus, in late September. There's been a lot of speculation surrounding Tesla's strategy in entering the robotics market, and a recent post by boss Elon Musk sheds some new light.

value.title: Tesla releases new picture of its upgraded supercomputer – one of the best in the world
value.excerpt: Tesla has released a new picture of its upgraded supercomputer, which is now believed to be the seventh most powerful computer in the world by GPU. For years now, Tesla has been teasing the development of a new supercomputer in-house optimized for neural net video training.

value.title: We tested Tesla Full Self-Driving Beta in the Blue Ridge Mountains, and it was scary
value.excerpt: Beta in the Blue Ridge Mountains in North Carolina, and it was a scary experience. FSD Beta enables Tesla vehicles to drive autonomously to a destination entered in the car’s navigation system, but the driver needs to remain vigilant and ready to take control at all times.

value.title: The Importance of International Norms in Artificial Intelligence Ethics
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence has arrived as a multi-purpose tool. The United States and its allies need to do more to establish norms and ensure AI is used in a way that does not harm human rights.

value.title: Tesla self-driving smear campaign releases ‘test’ that fails to realize FSD never engaged
value.excerpt: A Tesla Full Self-Driving smear campaign started by a California billionaire running for Senate has a new attack ad based on a FSD Beta “test,” where they failed to realize they never engaged FSD Beta during the test.

value.title: China's Baidu to operate driverless taxis in two cities
value.excerpt: WUHAN - Chinese tech giant Baidu has obtained permission to operate fully driverless taxis commercially on public roads in the cities of Wuhan and Chongqing. Baidu will offer the commercial robotaxi service -- with no driver present -- in some areas of the two cities via the company's autonomous ride-hailing platform Apollo Go.
